title: "How to develop a powerful gaze and presence through simple exercises?"
first_phrase: This text discusses the power of the gaze and how to develop a strong presence. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining eye contact without blinking and using mental energy to influence others. The text also includes exercises to help develop presence, including muscle tension and breathing techniques. The last 200 tokens discuss the concept of presence as a state of natural consciousness and reintegration, gathering insights from ancient traditions, including Gurdjieff and Yoga. The text highlights that to be truly present, one must want to become more aware of oneself and be fully engaged in the present moment.
content: The exercises that we present here for presence are: 1) Exercise of the point of standing; to maintain for as long as possible 2) Exercise of "three times ten minutes", to create a space for the presence 3) More useful exercises When to perform the recommended exercises? None of these exercises will actually steal your time, since you will perform them contemporarily to your daily activities. In particular, the exercise of the point of standing and "three times ten minutes" they must be performed as often as possible. Basic concepts The presence is a status of natural conscience, an enlarged perception compared to our concept of consciousness. It can also be defined as a status of "reintegration". Gurdjieff, many ancient alchemists, wise oriental Taoists, those who practice Yoga, and all of the esoteric traditions of all continents, they gather at the Summit on the concept of presence. Reintegration and Presence The presence is a gift essential to strengthen your fascinative force. Virtually, we do not leave anything out of us. In the practice, the first step is to develop the "know that we are there." If we are "present”, we are energetically denser in the situation. To develop such a gift, we have "to want” to become increasingly conscious of ourselves. We have to be "in things", not to live our life in our thoughts.
last_phrase: Incorporating presence exercises into your daily routine can strengthen your fascinative force and enhance your ability to be in the present moment. Start with the exercise of the point of standing and "three times ten minutes" and gradually move on to other exercises such as arm folding, focusing on touch sensations, and integrating sub-sensorialties. Remember to start with short durations and not exhaust yourself, and eventually, practice these exercises in the midst of noise and distractions to increase your concentration abilities. With consistent practice, you can develop an enlarged perception and reintegrate your natural conscience to live a more present life.
